fact: User approved creating a new task card and starting work immediately for a system-improvement plan.
User requested system-fit analysis and approved executing the assistant recommendation.
User wants all remaining repository changes committed and pushed to main, not only assistant-authored edits.
For Task T-034, Step 6 was confirmed complete by the user.
User explicitly prefers proactive execution with fewer confirmation questions when the next action is clearly beneficial.
User asked for simple, plain-language explanations of task benefits.
Git push to origin/main failed with remote rejection: pack exceeds maximum allowed size (2.00 GiB) and index-pack failed.
Default behavior: when user sends any link (including X posts), run the full established analysis process automatically unless user explicitly says no analysis.
For link-analysis requests in this thread, 'our system' and ongoing comparisons refer to the Fsuelsbot project.
Current objective for Fsuelsbot work: look for ways to improve the project.
User requires GitHub main to match the local project state so pulls on another machine reproduce the same workspace state.
User approved proceeding with the recommended Git strategy to align repository state.
User requested implementation of the Fsuelsbot ADAPT plan phases 1 and 2 now.
After asking for recommendation details, user confirmed to proceed with the assistant's recommended approach for ADAPT execution.
User wants direct execution with minimal questions and explicitly asked the assistant to 'just do it' using common sense.
User strongly dislikes repetitive/canned assistant phrasing and asked for code changes to stop repeated reply patterns.
User wants ideas from the referenced paper translated into concrete ways the AI agent can be more involved in money-making opportunities and process execution.
User explicitly prioritizes an aggressive, high-pressure money-making orientation for the agent rather than a soft or optional growth posture.
User asked what the 'most aggressive' operating mode would look like, indicating preference for concrete, forceful operating frameworks over abstract discussion.
User set an explicit performance floor of minimum $500 net profit per week across agents, with 7/14/30-day tracking and expectation to exceed baseline.
User instructed the assistant to pause actions while they modify code and wait for explicit go-ahead before continuing.
User wants memory to be a core part of the Fsuelsbot project and not depend on availability of any specific LLM provider.
User does not want provider-imposed memory retrieval limitations and expects continuity across Claude, OpenAI, and local open-source models.
In a live session, memory retrieval was unavailable because embedding backend credentials were missing; assistant could continue via local-file context while retrieval was offline.

Auto memory extraction cron retried embedding rebuild and still failed because embed_memories.py is missing at /Users/fsuels/clawd/scripts/memory/embed_memories.py.

When asking about an ongoing project, user expects the assistant to remember prior work and maintain continuity across sessions.
For DLM (dresslikemommy.com), user requested finding 12 new product listings.
Before executing DLM listing tasks, user wants the assistant to explain the planned sourcing process first.
For DLM product sourcing, user explicitly requires finding items on 1688.com from vendors that match mom-and-baby style/product criteria.
User asked to receive direct links for the 12 DLM products in chat so they can review them on their phone.
For 1688 sourcing, user set a hard freshness gate: product listings must be no older than 6 months.
User requires each selected 1688 listing to visibly show the vendor listing-creation date as freshness proof.
User repeatedly approved proceeding to execute strict filtering for 12 listings under the new 6-month freshness rule.
For DLM 12-listing sourcing, user escalated freshness requirement toward listings created this year (or no later than a tighter recency cutoff than prior rule).
User instructed assistant to proceed immediately with the previously specified process for the 12 listings (no additional planning pause).
